Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [yelling] Attention everyone! Jim and I, on behalf of-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Too loud.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: -the party planning committee...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Too, too loud. Too Loud.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: But effective, look! [everyone turns to pay attention] On behalf of Jim and I, Merry Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Everyone
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas. Good.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: My diabolical plot is on hold for Christmas. My heart just melts with the sound of children singing. Hmmph! [laughs] Not really! I'm just tired. The days are short. I don't know. Maybe I'm depressed.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is time to unveil the tree.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Hey, Rockefeller Center!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Uh, I have actually been to Rock Center, and this is nothing like that.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: This is all we have.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, it's not "ugh." It is... office camaraderie.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It is warm feelings.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Why don't we talk more about it instead of doing it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thirty! Twenty-nine! Twenty-eight! [others join]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Why would you start so high?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Twenty- seven! Twenty-six! ...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Three, two, one! [pulls sheet to reveal Christmas tree]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ooh.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ah!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You didn't decorate it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We didn't, because we think it'd be better to do it together.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why would you wrap it in a sheet, if you're not covering anything up?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is it, is it fake?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Pam!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes, we are unveiling, an artificial tree, that will never die...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Like the spirit of Christmas!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: We're supposed to applaud you for taking a giant diaper off fake tree?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This was a successful unveiling! Go back to work! Merry Christmas!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hello. Sorry guys. [louder, face is scratched up.] Sorry guys. I'm not sure I've earned the right to make announcements yet. But whoever is giving me the Twelve Days of Christmas? As my Secret Santa? Please stop. I can't take it anymore. My cat killed a turtledove; the French hens have started pulling out my hair to make a nest. Please. Stop.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: What psycho would send that as a gift? [Kelly hugs Erin]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I begged Dwight and Jim to give me Erin for Secret Santa. And I decided to give Erin the Twelve days of Christmas. Is it my fault that the first eight days is basically thirty birds? [six geese are inside Erin's car]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ho ho ho! Merry Christmas boys and girls! It's me, Santa Claus!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey Santa!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: They finally let you do it!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Congrats Phil!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It's so edgy!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I have been wanting to be Santa for years. I believe I have the right temperament, and the figure to do the job well. I slipped a note to Jim eleven weeks ago, and he said I could do it. [she awkwardly hugs Jim] It's been a long journey... but [sniffles] I'm Santa Claus!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So Santa, what can we expect from this party?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's going to be a very jolly time if you've been good!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: What if you've been bad?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh then nothing but a lump of coal for you!

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: What if you've been really, really bad? More evil, and strictly wrong?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, Creed, we covered it. Lump of coal!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: For several weeks, my Secret Santa has been giving me pieces of a machine that I've been attempting to assemble. I'm suspicious of this because I had the exact same idea, for catching Osama bin Laden. I would simply send him a different piece each day. He would assemble it, to find himself... in jail!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: You know Oscar every time I make this lasagna people ask me if it's a family recipe, but really, I just get the recipe from the box!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's funny.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is it funny? I thought it was more ...interesting, than funny. [she walks over to see Oscar at the window looking down on man catching a football in parking lot] I think my water just broke!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's too funny.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oscar and the warehouse guy! Go Oscar! Go gay warehouse guy!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Heeeeeere's Santa! Hey little girl, what would you like for Christmas? Ooh, you have been a very naughty girl, I see. [points to Pam's' pregnant tummy]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, we already have a Santa, Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What the hell is going on?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Phyllis, Jim? Phyllis is Santa?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Phyllis?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah I told her a long time ago she could do it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Take it back. That is absurd.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, I'm not gonna do that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No? No! Jim! Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I think she's doing a good job.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's insane! A woman Santa, where does it stop? No! Jim, this may be the last Christmas that we have here, doesn't it make you a tiny bit anxious, me NOT playing Santa? Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm not gonna go tell Phyllis that she can't be Santa.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Fine! Then do it anonymously. Ransom note style. You can- I -you know what, I have a bunch of letters cut out of magazines in my desk. You can use those.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If this were Russia, yeah sure. Everyone would go to one Santa, and there would be a line around the block and once you sat on her lap and she'd ask you what you wanted, you would say probably "freedom." At which point the KGB would arrest you and send you to Siberia. It's a good thing Russia doesn't exist anymore.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [santa voice] Ho ho ho! Why pay more to sit next to old Tranny Claus over there, when you can sit on my lap. Phyllis is only ... pretending to be a man, I'm the real thing. Sit down on my lap and there will be no doubt!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: [mutters] Okay...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No it's not, not like penis-wise. [as Santa] Hello little boy, what's your name?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael it's me, Kevin. Phyllis says I'm too big for her lap.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! I am so sorry that Phyllis hates you. And hates your body. But, Santa remembers a reindeer that was just a tiny bit different as well.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: When can I sit on your lap?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Right now! Come on over here, big boy! There we go. [Kevin sits on his lap. It's a struggle] Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: That's really comfortable. [Michael gasps]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What would you like for Christmas little boy?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I don't know. I didn't know you were gonna ask me that.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What did you think was going to happen?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I didn't know. Nobody's ever let me sit on their lap before.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right, just say "some toys" please.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Can you give me some choices? Cause I really don't want to mess up on this list.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Damn it Kevin, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: What about if I tell you the things I don't want?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay get off, get off! [pushes Kevin off] Oh! Oh, God!

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I didn't even get to tell you what I wanted!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay you know what you get? You get a thousand helium balloons attached to you so Santa doesn't have to go through this again.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Awesome.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Well?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm trying Phyllis. You're Santa.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: The only Santa.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's what I want.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: You promised me this. Don't make me get Bob involved!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What would Bob do?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Never mind, I shouldn't have said that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Does it hurt?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It stings a lot.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I keep trying to figure out who's sending me these gifts.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I know, right?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: So far no one will admit to it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Huh!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Is it you? [Andy stage face, eyes pop, big mouth smile, Erin laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah! Totally! I admit it! It's me.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Seriously?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: "Seriously?" Are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah! Totally serious! I'm your Secret Santa! Busted!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: There he is.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Is Matt around? I got his check.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Uh, Matt is on a delivery. Just leave it here, I'll take it.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Ah, I'll just... wait for him.

Quote.Speaker: Daryl
Quote.Text: Matt's a pretty good-looking dude, don't you think?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'll just leave it here with you. [drops checks, leaves. Daryl smirks]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ryan come here!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Whoa, whoa.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: I'm doing something over here.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Ahhh... Ho ho ho! [struggles to pull Ryan towards him] Come on I need this. Come over here!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Just sit down!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No no no.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey hey hey. Everything okay?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yup. Ryan and I are just having some fun!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Can I just talk to you for a second?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Whoop! Okay, what?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You can't yell out "I need this, I need this" as you pin down an employee on your lap!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. You know what Jim, there are two Santas in the room. Things get ruthless!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yup.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you understand, you forced my hand?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, it's Phyllis. We want Phyllis as Santa.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, do we? Do "We?" Is that what "we" want? Why don't "we" take a vote on it?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Great!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! Okay! Everybody! The office is being pulled apart! I realize that. There are traditions at stake. And there are-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Who wants Phyllis as Santa? [most everyone raises their hand]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No no no wait! No! There are other choices, there is information that we -[Dwight counts the raised hands] Are you kidding me? Kevin? After you almost killed me?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Michael I had you. I just want to try Phyllis.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And if you want Michael as Santa, raise your hand. [Michael, then Dwight raises hand] Can I get you some punch?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll get some punch. That looks delicious. [shoves Santa hat into punch]

Quote.Speaker: Office
Quote.Text: Aw, Michael!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Excuse me. Whoever has been sending me the parts to this gun, I think you sent me a gear instead of a trigger.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: How do you know it's a gun?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What else does it look like?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Not a gun.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Well I don't have all the pieces yet.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Well, unless the missing piece is a gun, you don't have a gun.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Not a gun. [crosses gun off his "what could it be" list]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: In the North Pole I spend many nights alone tinkering with toys. So today, let's put a twinkle in Ole Kris Kringle's eye! Let the party begin! [Dwight plugs in tree lights, office applauds.]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't ask for much for Christmas, I really don't. It's not like I'm begging people to buy me diamonds and ...broach pendants. "Oh buy me something expensive or I'm gonna kill myself." That's not - I don't care about that. All I want to be is Santa. And, you want to take that away from me? Fine. Go ahead. But when you need my help because I am ruining everything, don't look at me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Behold! [extends his arms] Jesus Christ. And I bring to you glad Christmas tidings. I want to remind everyone the true meaning of Christmas. [Angela claps] Those of you who wish to join me, that's great. I'm excited by that. And those of you who don't, I forgive you. But I never forget.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Wow Michael, like this must be obvious how wrong this is.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh the Anti-Christ!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You can't, [Michael touches his forehead and makes sizzling noise] Ow. Look, you cannot push religion.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh but I can push drugs in here? Is that what you're saying?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well you have to pick one or the other. Your choice. Pick your poison. Get back to me. In the meantime, I am going to spread my goodness all over this company!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey Phyllis, could you not reveal to Erin that I'm her Secret Santa?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: All right sweetie, I'll tell her its Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly and Erin
Quote.Text: [singing] I saw three ships come sailing in, on Christmas day, on Christmas day...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Have you talked to him?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Who?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Matt?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Is it that obvious? [Pam starts towards Matt] No- hey...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmm! Good pate, right? [Matt nods yes] Oscar made it. Have you met Oscar?

Quote.Speaker: Matt
Quote.Text: I don't think so.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hey, Oscar, come here. Oscar, this is Matt, and um, Matt loves your pate.

Quote.Speaker: Matt
Quote.Text: I had some.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oscar's pate is great. I could eat it all day, every day. Mmm. How come the good ones are never straight, right?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Okay Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes! They're the only two gay guys I know. But they should be together.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: This just arrived from the Dunder Mifflin North Pole branch!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: We don't have a North Pole branch. Idiot. [grabs package]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on karaoke microphone] Uh oh, what's Dwight gonna get? What is iiiit?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes! [Dwight opens package to reveal another machine part]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh yes. It's space garbage. Dwight's gonna be able to build himself a friend! [sings] Deck the halls with crappy gifts...

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ho ho ho! For Stanley! Ho ho ho! You've been very good this year -

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I have.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on microphone] Yeah, except for cheating on your wife. Adultery's a sin, look it up in the Bible people. What'd you get?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: He got scented candles!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on microphone] Oh, that's appropriate. Lot of fire where you're going. Better get used to it. You're going to H-E-L-L double hockey sticks. You're going to Hell Stanley.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Amen.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: And this brings us to you, little one.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on microphone] I can't see from here people. Somebody shout it out, don't make me get up.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's fabric! I really wanted this.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on microphone] That's fantastic. You can make another dress that goes past your feet.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Andy, is this you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on microphone] No!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: It's a secret.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on microphone] Andy had Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nnnnya.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [on microphone] What? Was I not supposed to say it? [Jim unplugs mic] What? Turn it back on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. [Michael gets up and walks into his office]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yes Michael, what is so urgent?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: David, guess who I'm sitting here dressed as.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I'm not going to guess. You can tell me or I am going to hang up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll give you a hint. His last name is Christ. He has the power of flight. He can heal leopards.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm Jesus, David, and you know why? Because Phyllis, a woman, has uslurped my role as Santa.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: This is a very very bad time.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? What's going on?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Stephanie, can you hop off please?

Quote.Speaker: Stephanie
Quote.Text: Sure David. [disconnect]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What the hell? How rude! Does she do that all the time?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Do you want me off the call too Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey! Get off! Get off the phone!

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Listen, I shouldn't tell you this, but the company has a buyer. The board will have no choice to approve. They are going to clean house.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What does that mean?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I'll be fired.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, can't Alan protect you?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Alan will be out too. All of us.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All of us?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Goodbye Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh my God.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Earlier today this office needed a Santa. And then it needed a second Santa. And then it needed a Jesus. And now, it needs a Michael. And that's one suit Phyllis cannot fit into.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey. How's everybody doing?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not great. You heckled Santa for an hour and a half.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was a different guy. That was Jesus. Jesus sort of ruined the party. Hurt petulant Jesus.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Are you serious? This is so offensive.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what's even more offensive, is baling on this party because some... jerk ruined the first part of it. Dwight come here. Here's my debit card, I want you to go pick up a bunch of pizzas and meet me in the conference room.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: What's your pin number?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I don't want to say. But, "it's fun to stay at the -" [nods to fill in blank, but Dwight doesn't know]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: "It's fun to stay at the -"

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Where? Holiday Inn? I don't ...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [gestures the YMCA dance] Mmm, mm mm mm. [Dwight smirks, leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I, I thought that you would like it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: It was a little much Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well it's the thought that counts.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What were you thinking? [Andy freezes]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I suppose a gentlemen might... throw in the towel, at this point. Guess what? Not gonna happen.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You know what, Christmas isn't about Santa, or Jesus. It's about the workplace. All of you feel like my family. Ryan, you are my son. And Pam, you're my wife. And Jim. And Angela and Phyllis, you are my Grandmas. And Stanley, you're our mailman. And I can't help but look at all your wonderful beautiful faces and think, "How could they do this to us?"

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How could we do what? [general murmur]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's not... Nevermind. Nothing. [arguing voices]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: We deserve to know.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I didn't say anything!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: If you know something Michael...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're going out of business!

Quote.Speaker: Group
Quote.Text: WHAT?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You are kidding me!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Wait wait wait, who said that?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: David told me on the phone. David told me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: When? When did he tell you? Today?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Earlier today.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Awww!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He said, we have been sold. [upset murmurs]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aaaarrhh! [kicks over Christmas tree]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight! Jesus!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Michael, wait. So they said we are sold?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: David's gone. Alan's gone. We're all gone.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Okay. We haven't gone under. We've been sold and that can mean many different things.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's hard for me to imagine a scenario, where Meredith Palmer keeps her job and David Wallace does not - no offense Meredith.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: No, I get it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'll call him. I'll call David.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No, you won't, because he's not picking up his phone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yes, I will. Because I always know how to get through to him.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: He told me where his kids go to school. I call the school, I tell them I'm a pediatrician. They patch me through to his secretary. I use my little girl voice. Badda bing, badda boom.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Hey Sweetie, what is it?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It's not sweetie, it's Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: What the hell?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stephanie could you hop off please?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Michael, I have never-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: David!

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Ever, ever...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: David, you are on speakerphone with the entire branch, and the warehouse.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hey David.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Hi David! [group hellos]

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Hello everyone.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: David, they do not believe me. When you told me everyone was canned.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You weren't supposed to tell anyone Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well I think we're past that now.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I am not supposed to... Okay. Guys. I was really only talking about Alan, myself, a few other execs you don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God, David. That's horrible.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: How 'bout us? It's Meredith. By the way, your wife is a very lucky woman.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Look. They're buying the company for the distribution. You guys are the only thing about this company that works. So congratulations.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: We're not fired?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No! No, and congratulations.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah! [office erupts in cheers and applause and hugs] It's a Christmas miracle!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Woo hoo! [climbs on desk, stage dives into crowd of employees]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [singing] I walk a lonely road, the only one that I have ever known. Don't know where it goes, but it's home to me and I walk alone. [Meredith and Madge help right the Christmas tree]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's true. We all walk alone.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: [opens "New Moon" poster] Jim.... Jim! [Hugs him]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [singing] My shadow's the only one that walks beside me. My shallow heart's the only thing that's beating...

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [opening kite from Ryan] Wow! Cause... [reveals Kite Runner book]

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah! That was the idea.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Thank you!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Awesome!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Thanks man! [awkwardly tries to hug Ryan, pats him on the back]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [singing] Christmas tree, oh Christmas tree, thy leaves are so unchanging...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh! You got it? What is that? [Dwight building his gift]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I have no idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Huh. Well, maybe those will help. [puts bag of walnuts on his desk]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Michael? Please! Come on!

Quote.Speaker: Matt
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you Mark!

Quote.Speaker: Matt
Quote.Text: It's Matt.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Right, Matt. [Matt leaves] I know what I'm doing, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Oh man! [Dwight dropped a walnut into the nutcracker] I can use this for so many nuts! Macadamias, Brazil nuts, pecans, almonds. Clams, snails...

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi Santa.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hi Michael. [Michael sits on her lap] Mm. 'kay.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'd like to make a wish.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I would like an Xbox, and a TV that's compatible with an Xbox. And, I'm sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: An Xbox it is. Because I've decided you're a good boy.

Quote.Speaker: Bob Vance
Quote.Text: Scott! What in the hell is going on here? [Bob enters dressed as Santa too]

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: No Bob, we worked it out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You called Bob?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm sorry,

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Come on! Phyllis!

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm really sorry. It was earlier today.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Hi sweetie.

Quote.Speaker: Bob
Quote.Text: You okay baby?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I'm good baby. [they kiss, both dressed as Santa]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh God. Get a room Santas!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you Santa. Happy Holidays.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's real slippery out here. [sound of drummer's starts]

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh my God!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Twelve drummers drumming. [marching drum band lines up to perform, Andy steps out with cymbals]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Merry Christmas Erin! Take it away boys! [dances along to the drumming]
